result.execSummary:
The defendant Oluwagbenga B. Awe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Huber priveleges for work and any childcare.
Consecutive to: to 13CT210

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Oluwagbenga B. Awe in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland.    ADA David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM16, 13CT210 and 13CM282.

3:42 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

**13CT210:**
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 - No Contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 and Count 1 is dismissed.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - Dismissed

Count 2 -
10 days county jail with huber priveleges for work and any childcare
Sentence to commence within 60 days from today's date
Go to jail today for start date
Pay fine + costs totalling $1,172.00
Pay blood draw of $33.33
Pay fine within 60 days or set up payment plan
13 month DL revocation - Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
13 month IID on any vehicles owned, operated or titled in his name effective today's date
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.

**15CM16:**
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Counts 2 & 3 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

AttyKnaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland  makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
5 days county jail consecutive to Count 1 in 13CT210 with huber priveleges for work and any childcare
Pay court costs

**Total jail is 15 days with 8 days confinement and 7 days on home detention

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI


**13CM282:**
Count's 1-3 are DRI
